column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Was given a prescription to take every day (no skipping or blanks).  Had been bleeding for 7 weeks straight (peri-menopause).  Bleeding stopped, then had one period lasting 7 days.  However, I am also being treated for depression and this medication caused me to become severly depressed.  I do not recommend this medication for anyone with depression or anxiety.

column9: Took about 4 months to work with my body but cramping is gone completely.  Some weight gain, some dizziness and occasional nausea.  Slight swelling in fingers every so often.  None of these symptoms are enough to make me want to quit taking the med.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 31 years old, and sadly had to have a hysterectomy at the age of 30 due to accute endometriosis, I just couldn't deal with the pain anymore. After the surgery,which was a Laparospic Assisted Vaganal Hysterectomy, my doctor, Dr. Richard C. Griffin, put me on Norethindrone and I am feeling much much better. :) ~ La

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have endometriosis and the only relief I have found is the Lupron Depot shot. This pill was also prescribed as add back therapy for it. The Lupron Depot sent me into a menopausal state (hot flashes, night sweats, mood swings). I found that combined with the norethindrone acetate (Aygestin), those symptoms went away. I could clearly tell when I missed a pill. I've been dealing with endometriosis for over 8 years, and the 6 months I used it was the only time I felt "normal". After a year off the drug, all of my endometriosis symptoms are at their worst. My GYN has prescribed this drug again and I am very thankful for that. Combined with the Lupron Depot shot, I think Aygestin is GREAT.

column2: cristina, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: do not take this drug.  My wife took it to stop uterus bleeding before her hysterectomy surgery and it caused her to lose sight in her eye. This is the most serious side effect that is not on the label or bottle.  She is undergoing surgery and all doctors agree that this drug caused the blood clot to stop the eye from working. Please be careful.

column2: fterry1982, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: i took this med as an add on for the shot for endometriosis and it gave me tremendous headaches, severe, severe mood swings, and horrible nightsweats! i do not recommend this medicine for anyone. if you are taking it get off it now and try something else. your life will be much better!!

column2: lovinahall, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  (Patient)
column9: I have been using this treatment for a year and a half I think it works well.  I am only 21 and have had endometriosis, so this pill was the easiest way to keep that at bay.  However now I am starting to notice all the side effects.  I exercise every day but don't seem to lose any weight, I'm terribly moody (mostly when I'm already under stress), and I feel like I am going through menopause. I feel as though this is a wonderful short term treatment, but I am sure hoping that my doctor and I will come up with a better long term treatment soon!

column2: Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: At first this medication was great for stopping the bleeding and pain associated with endometriosis. After being on the medication for a year, the side effects began to intensify. A year and a half later, I had 8 of the 12 listed side effects handed to me in a pamphlet at the pharmacy. I gained 25 lbs. although I ran or worked out every day. The nausea was the worst part, closely followed by the incredibly painful acne. This was a great short term medication for me but I would not recommend it to any of my friends.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Though the medication is easy to use, I am not satisfied with how it makes me feel.  After reading the side effects I now realize that the symptoms that I have been experiencing are normal.  I have had difficulty sleeping, night sweats, headaches, extreme moodiness and prolonged periods.  To me this is not the ideal treatment for endometriosis.
